text: If x varies directly as square root of y and x = 81 when y = 9, Find x when y = 1\(\frac{7}{9}\)
explanation:
x \(\alpha\sqrt y\)x = k\(\sqrt y\)81 = k\(\sqrt9\)k = \(\frac{81}{3}\)= 27therefore, x = 27\(\sqrt y\)y = 1\(\frac{7}{9}\) = \(\frac{16}{9}\)x = 27 x \(\sqrt{\frac{16}{9}}\)= 27 x \(\frac{4}{3}\)dividing 27 by 3= 9 x 4= 36

text: Solve the inequality -6(x + 3) \(\leq\) 4(x - 2)
explanation:
-6(x + 3) \(\leq\) 4(x - 2)-6(x +3) \(\leq\) 4(x - 2)-6x -18 \(\leq\) 4x - 8-18 + 8 \(\leq\) 4x +6x-10 \(\leq\) 10x10x \(\geq\) -10x \(\geq\) -1

text: If \(\begin{vmatrix} 2 & 3 \\ 5 & 3x \end{vmatrix}\) = \(\begin{vmatrix} 4 & 1 \\ 3 & 2x \end{vmatrix}\), find the value of x.
explanation:
\(\begin{vmatrix} 2 & 3 \\ 5 & 3x \end{vmatrix}\) = \(\begin{vmatrix} 4 & 1 \\ 3 & 2x \end{vmatrix}\)(2 x 3x) - (5 x 3) = (4 x 2x) - (3 x 1)6x - 15 = 8x - 36x - 8x = 15 - 3-2x = 12x = \(\frac{12}{-2}\)= -6

text: A chord of circle of radius 7cm is 5cm from the centre of the circle.What is the length of the chord?
explanation:
From Pythagoras theorem|OA|2 = |AN|2 + |ON|272 = |AN|2 + (5)249 = |AN|2 + 25|AN|2 = 49 - 25 = 24|AN| = \(\sqrt {24}\)= \(\sqrt {4 \times 6}\)= 2√6 cm|AN| = |NB| (A line drawn from the centre of a circle to a chord, divides the chord into two equal parts)|AN| + |NB| = |AB|2√6 + 2√6 = |AB||AB| = 4√6 cm

text: The midpoint of P(x, y) and Q(8, 6) is (5, 8). Find x and y.
explanation:
P(x, y) Q(8, 6)midpoint = (5, 8)x + 8 = 5\(\frac{y + 6}{2}\) = 8x + 8 = 10x = 10 - 8 = 2y + 6 = 16y + 16 - 6 = 10therefore, P(2, 10)
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: Find the equation of a line perpendicular to line 2y = 5x + 4 which passes through (4, 2).
explanation:
2y = 5x + 4 (4, 2)y = \(\frac{5x}{2}\) + 4 comparing withy = mx + em = \(\frac{5}{2}\)Since they are perpendicularm1m2 = -1m2 = \(\frac{-1}{m_1}\) = -1\(\frac{5}{2}\) = -1 x \(\frac{2}{5}\)The equator of the line is thusy = mn + c (4, 2)2 = -\(\frac{2}{5}\)(4) + c\(\frac{2}{1}\) + \(\frac{8}{5}\) = cc = \(\frac{18}{5}\)
y = -\(\frac{2}{5}\)x + \(\frac{18}{5}\)5y = -2x + 18or 5y + 2x - 18 = 0
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: In a right angled triangle, if tan \(\theta\) = \(\frac{3}{4}\). What is cos\(\theta\) - sin\(\theta\)?
explanation:
tan\(\theta\) = \(\frac{3}{4}\)from Pythagoras tippet, the hypotenus is Ti.e. 3, 4, 5.then sin \(\theta\) = \(\frac{3}{5}\) and cos\(\theta\) = \(\frac{4}{5}\)cos\(\theta\) - sin\(\theta\)\(\frac{4}{5}\) - \(\frac{3}{5}\) = \(\frac{1}{5}\)

text: Find the value of x at the minimum point of the curve y = x3 + x2 - x + 1
explanation:
y = x3 + x2 - x + 1\(\frac{dy}{dx}\) = \(\frac{d(x^3)}{dx}\) + \(\frac{d(x^2)}{dx}\) - \(\frac{d(x)}{dx}\) + \(\frac{d(1)}{dx}\)\(\frac{dy}{dx}\) = 3x2 + 2x - 1 = 0\(\frac{dy}{dx}\) = 3x2 + 2x - 1At the maximum point \(\frac{dy}{dx}\) = 03x2 + 2x - 1 = 0(3x2 + 3x) - (x - 1) = 03x(x + 1) -1(x + 1) = 0(3x - 1)(x + 1) = 0therefore x = \(\frac{1}{3}\) or -1For the maximum point\(\frac{d^2y}{dx^2}\) < 0\(\frac{d^2y}{dx^2}\) 6x + 2when x = \(\frac{1}{3}\)\(\frac{dx^2}{dx^2}\) = 6(\(\frac{1}{3}\)) + 2= 2 + 2 = 4\(\frac{d^2y}{dx^2}\) > o which is the minimum pointwhen x = -1\(\frac{d^2y}{dx^2}\) = 6(-1) + 2= -6 + 2 = -4-4 < 0therefore, \(\frac{d^2y}{dx^2}\) < 0the minimum point is 1/3
There is an explanation video availablebelow.

text: In how many was can the letters of the word ELATION be arranged?
explanation:
ELATIONSince there are 7 letters. The first letter can be arranged in 7 ways, , the second letter in 6 ways, the third letter in 5 ways, the 4th letter in four ways, the 3rd letter in three ways, the 2nd letter in 2 ways and the last in one way.therefore, 7 x 6 x 5 x 4 x 3 x 2 x 1 = 7! ways
